item.title: OpenBike
item.description: Codeberg Repository: https://codeberg.org/cyberme0w/open-bike F-Droid: https://f-droid.org/packages/dev.cyberme0w.openbike/ Open Bike For the uninitiated, nextbike is a bike-sharing company. Users pay a fee and can rent bikes from multiple stations within a city, with some cities offering ‘floating’ bikes, which can be rented and returned anywhere. I myself have been a mostly happy customer of nextbike for some time now. In my case, not having to deal with maintenance, as well as not using up precious space in my small apartment are great benefits.

item.title: dmbm
item.description: Repository: https://codeberg.org/cyberme0w/dmbm dmbm is a bookmarking extension for dmenu, a launcher for tiling window managers such as i3 or dwm. Since it is not bound to any specific browser and instead uses xdotool, you can use it across multiple browsers, as well as any other program that accepts cursor input. This also makes it a viable copy-pasta board! It is written in bash, which makes it easily extensible, and stores bookmarks in plain text, within a folder-hierarchy.
